00070 struct ptldebug_header {
00071         __u32 ph_len;
00072         __u32 ph_flags;
00073         __u32 ph_subsys;
00074         __u32 ph_mask;
00075         __u16 ph_cpu_id;
00076         __u16 ph_type;
00077         __u32 ph_sec;
00078         __u64 ph_usec;
00079         __u32 ph_stack;
00080         __u32 ph_pid;
00081         __u32 ph_extern_pid;
00082         __u32 ph_line_num;
00083 } __attribute__((packed));

00086 #define PH_FLAG_FIRST_RECORD 1
00087 
00088 /* Debugging subsystems (32 bits, non-overlapping) */
00089 #define S_UNDEFINED     0x00000001
00090 #define S_MDC           0x00000002
00091 #define S_MDS           0x00000004
00092 #define S_OSC           0x00000008
00093 #define S_OST           0x00000010
00094 #define S_CLASS         0x00000020
00095 #define S_LOG           0x00000040
00096 #define S_LLITE         0x00000080
00097 #define S_RPC           0x00000100
00098 #define S_MGMT          0x00000200
00099 #define S_LNET          0x00000400
00100 #define S_LND           0x00000800 /* ALL LNDs */
00101 #define S_PINGER        0x00001000
00102 #define S_FILTER        0x00002000
00103 /* unused */
00104 #define S_ECHO          0x00008000
00105 #define S_LDLM          0x00010000
00106 #define S_LOV           0x00020000
00107 #define S_LQUOTA        0x00040000
00108 #define S_OSD           0x00080000
00109 #define S_LFSCK         0x00100000
00110 /* unused */
00111 /* unused */
00112 #define S_LMV           0x00800000 /* b_new_cmd */
00113 /* unused */
00114 #define S_SEC           0x02000000 /* upcall cache */
00115 #define S_GSS           0x04000000 /* b_new_cmd */
00116 /* unused */
00117 #define S_MGC           0x10000000
00118 #define S_MGS           0x20000000
00119 #define S_FID           0x40000000 /* b_new_cmd */
00120 #define S_FLD           0x80000000 /* b_new_cmd */
00121 
00122 #define LIBCFS_DEBUG_SUBSYS_NAMES {                                     \
00123         "undefined", "mdc", "mds", "osc", "ost", "class", "log",        \
00124         "llite", "rpc", "mgmt", "lnet", "lnd", "pinger", "filter", "",  \
00125         "echo", "ldlm", "lov", "lquota", "osd", "lfsck", "", "", "lmv", \
00126          "", "sec", "gss", "", "mgc", "mgs", "fid", "fld", NULL }
00127 
00128 /* Debugging masks (32 bits, non-overlapping) */
00129 #define D_TRACE         0x00000001 /* ENTRY/EXIT markers */
00130 #define D_INODE         0x00000002
00131 #define D_SUPER         0x00000004
00132 #define D_EXT2          0x00000008 /* anything from ext2_debug */
00133 #define D_MALLOC        0x00000010 /* print malloc, free information */
00134 #define D_CACHE         0x00000020 /* cache-related items */
00135 #define D_INFO          0x00000040 /* general information */
00136 #define D_IOCTL         0x00000080 /* ioctl related information */
00137 #define D_NETERROR      0x00000100 /* network errors */
00138 #define D_NET           0x00000200 /* network communications */
00139 #define D_WARNING       0x00000400 /* CWARN(...) == CDEBUG (D_WARNING, ...) */
00140 #define D_BUFFS         0x00000800
00141 #define D_OTHER         0x00001000
00142 #define D_DENTRY        0x00002000
00143 #define D_NETTRACE      0x00004000
00144 #define D_PAGE          0x00008000 /* bulk page handling */
00145 #define D_DLMTRACE      0x00010000
00146 #define D_ERROR         0x00020000 /* CERROR(...) == CDEBUG (D_ERROR, ...) */
00147 #define D_EMERG         0x00040000 /* CEMERG(...) == CDEBUG (D_EMERG, ...) */
00148 #define D_HA            0x00080000 /* recovery and failover */
00149 #define D_RPCTRACE      0x00100000 /* for distributed debugging */
00150 #define D_VFSTRACE      0x00200000
00151 #define D_READA         0x00400000 /* read-ahead */
00152 #define D_MMAP          0x00800000
00153 #define D_CONFIG        0x01000000
00154 #define D_CONSOLE       0x02000000
00155 #define D_QUOTA         0x04000000
00156 #define D_SEC           0x08000000
00157 #define D_LFSCK         0x10000000 /* For both OI scrub and LFSCK */
00158 #define D_HSM           0x20000000
00159 
00160 #define LIBCFS_DEBUG_MASKS_NAMES {                                      \
00161         "trace", "inode", "super", "ext2", "malloc", "cache", "info",   \
00162         "ioctl", "neterror", "net", "warning", "buffs", "other",        \
00163         "dentry", "nettrace", "page", "dlmtrace", "error", "emerg",     \
00164         "ha", "rpctrace", "vfstrace", "reada", "mmap", "config",        \
00165         "console", "quota", "sec", "lfsck", "hsm", NULL }
00166 
00167 #define D_CANTMASK   (D_ERROR | D_EMERG | D_WARNING | D_CONSOLE)
00168 
00169 #ifndef DEBUG_SUBSYSTEM
00170 # define DEBUG_SUBSYSTEM S_UNDEFINED
00171 #endif
00172 
00173 #define CDEBUG_DEFAULT_MAX_DELAY (cfs_time_seconds(600))         /* jiffies */
00174 #define CDEBUG_DEFAULT_MIN_DELAY ((cfs_time_seconds(1) + 1) / 2) /* jiffies */
00175 #define CDEBUG_DEFAULT_BACKOFF   2
00176 struct cfs_debug_limit_state {
00177         unsigned long   cdls_next;
00178         unsigned int    cdls_delay;
00179         int             cdls_count;
00180 };
00181 
00182 struct libcfs_debug_msg_data {
00183         const char                      *msg_file;
00184         const char                      *msg_fn;
00185         int                              msg_subsys;
00186         int                              msg_line;
00187         int                              msg_mask;
00188         struct cfs_debug_limit_state    *msg_cdls;
00189 };
00190 
00191 #define LIBCFS_DEBUG_MSG_DATA_INIT(data, mask, cdls)        \
00192 do {                                                        \
00193         (data)->msg_subsys = DEBUG_SUBSYSTEM;               \
00194         (data)->msg_file   = __FILE__;                      \
00195         (data)->msg_fn     = __FUNCTION__;                  \
00196         (data)->msg_line   = __LINE__;                      \
00197         (data)->msg_cdls   = (cdls);                        \
00198         (data)->msg_mask   = (mask);                        \
00199 } while (0)
00200 
00201 #define LIBCFS_DEBUG_MSG_DATA_DECL(dataname, mask, cdls)    \
00202         static struct libcfs_debug_msg_data dataname = {    \
00203                .msg_subsys = DEBUG_SUBSYSTEM,               \
00204                .msg_file   = __FILE__,                      \
00205                .msg_fn     = __FUNCTION__,                  \
00206                .msg_line   = __LINE__,                      \
00207                .msg_cdls   = (cdls)         };              \
00208         dataname.msg_mask   = (mask);
00209 
00210 #ifdef __KERNEL__
00211 
00212 # ifdef CDEBUG_ENABLED
00213 
00217 static inline int cfs_cdebug_show(unsigned int mask, unsigned int subsystem)
00218 {
00219         return mask & D_CANTMASK ||
00220                 ((libcfs_debug & mask) && (libcfs_subsystem_debug & subsystem));
00221 }
00222 
00223 #  define __CDEBUG(cdls, mask, format, ...)                             \
00224 do {                                                                    \
00225         static struct libcfs_debug_msg_data msgdata;                    \
00226                                                                         \
00227         CFS_CHECK_STACK(&msgdata, mask, cdls);                          \
00228                                                                         \
00229         if (cfs_cdebug_show(mask, DEBUG_SUBSYSTEM)) {                   \
00230                 LIBCFS_DEBUG_MSG_DATA_INIT(&msgdata, mask, cdls);       \
00231                 libcfs_debug_msg(&msgdata, format, ## __VA_ARGS__);     \
00232         }                                                               \
00233 } while (0)
00234 
00235 #  define CDEBUG(mask, format, ...) __CDEBUG(NULL, mask, format, ## __VA_ARGS__)
00236 
00237 #  define CDEBUG_LIMIT(mask, format, ...)                               \
00238 do {                                                                    \
00239         static struct cfs_debug_limit_state cdls;                       \
00240                                                                         \
00241         __CDEBUG(&cdls, mask, format, ## __VA_ARGS__);                  \
00242 } while (0)
00243 
00244 # else /* !CDEBUG_ENABLED */
00245 static inline int cfs_cdebug_show(unsigned int mask, unsigned int subsystem)
00246 {
00247         return 0;
00248 }
00249 #  define CDEBUG(mask, format, ...) (void)(0)
00250 #  define CDEBUG_LIMIT(mask, format, ...) (void)(0)
00251 #  warning "CDEBUG IS DISABLED. THIS SHOULD NEVER BE DONE FOR PRODUCTION!"
00252 # endif /* CDEBUG_ENABLED */
00253 
00254 #else /* !__KERNEL__ */
00255 static inline int cfs_cdebug_show(unsigned int mask, unsigned int subsystem)
00256 {
00257         return 0;
00258 }
00259 # define CDEBUG(mask, format, ...)                                      \
00260 do {                                                                    \
00261         if (((mask) & D_CANTMASK) != 0)                                 \
00262                 fprintf(stderr, "(%s:%d:%s()) " format,                 \
00263                         __FILE__, __LINE__, __FUNCTION__, ## __VA_ARGS__);\
00264 } while (0)
00265 
00266 # define CDEBUG_LIMIT CDEBUG
00267 
00268 #endif /* __KERNEL__ */
00269 
00270 /*
00271  * Lustre Error Checksum: calculates checksum
00272  * of Hex number by XORing each bit.
00273  */
00274 #define LERRCHKSUM(hexnum) (((hexnum) & 0xf) ^ ((hexnum) >> 4 & 0xf) ^ \
00275                            ((hexnum) >> 8 & 0xf))
00276 
00277 #define CWARN(format, ...)          CDEBUG_LIMIT(D_WARNING, format, ## __VA_ARGS__)
00278 #define CERROR(format, ...)         CDEBUG_LIMIT(D_ERROR, format, ## __VA_ARGS__)
00279 #define CNETERR(format, a...)       CDEBUG_LIMIT(D_NETERROR, format, ## a)
00280 #define CEMERG(format, ...)         CDEBUG_LIMIT(D_EMERG, format, ## __VA_ARGS__)
00281 
00282 #define LCONSOLE(mask, format, ...) CDEBUG(D_CONSOLE | (mask), format, ## __VA_ARGS__)
00283 #define LCONSOLE_INFO(format, ...)  CDEBUG_LIMIT(D_CONSOLE, format, ## __VA_ARGS__)
00284 #define LCONSOLE_WARN(format, ...)  CDEBUG_LIMIT(D_CONSOLE | D_WARNING, format, ## __VA_ARGS__)
00285 #define LCONSOLE_ERROR_MSG(errnum, format, ...) CDEBUG_LIMIT(D_CONSOLE | D_ERROR, \
00286                            "%x-%x: " format, errnum, LERRCHKSUM(errnum), ## __VA_ARGS__)
00287 #define LCONSOLE_ERROR(format, ...) LCONSOLE_ERROR_MSG(0x00, format, ## __VA_ARGS__)
00288 
00289 #define LCONSOLE_EMERG(format, ...) CDEBUG(D_CONSOLE | D_EMERG, format, ## __VA_ARGS__)
00290 
00291 #if defined(CDEBUG_ENTRY_EXIT) && defined(__KERNEL__)
00292 
00293 void libcfs_log_goto(struct libcfs_debug_msg_data *goto_data,
00294                      const char *label, long_ptr_t rc);
00295 
00296 # define GOTO(label, rc)                                                \
00297 do {                                                                    \
00298         if (cfs_cdebug_show(D_TRACE, DEBUG_SUBSYSTEM)) {                \
00299                 LIBCFS_DEBUG_MSG_DATA_DECL(_goto_data, D_TRACE, NULL);  \
00300                 libcfs_log_goto(&_goto_data, #label, (long_ptr_t)(rc)); \
00301         } else {                                                        \
00302                 (void)(rc);                                             \
00303         }                                                               \
00304                                                                         \
00305         goto label;                                                     \
00306 } while (0)
00307 
00308 
00309 long libcfs_log_return(struct libcfs_debug_msg_data *, long rc);
00310 # if BITS_PER_LONG > 32
00311 #  define RETURN(rc)                                                    \
00312 do {                                                                    \
00313         if (cfs_cdebug_show(D_TRACE, DEBUG_SUBSYSTEM)) {                \
00314                 LIBCFS_DEBUG_MSG_DATA_DECL(msgdata, D_TRACE, NULL);     \
00315                 return (typeof(rc))libcfs_log_return(&msgdata,          \
00316                                                      (long)(rc));       \
00317         }                                                               \
00318                                                                         \
00319         return (rc);                                                    \
00320 } while (0)
00321 # else /* BITS_PER_LONG == 32 */
00322 /* We need an on-stack variable, because we cannot case a 32-bit pointer
00323  * directly to (long long) without generating a complier warning/error, yet
00324  * casting directly to (long) will truncate 64-bit return values. The log
00325  * values will print as 32-bit values, but they always have been. LU-1436
00326  */
00327 #  define RETURN(rc)                                                    \
00328 do {                                                                    \
00329         if (cfs_cdebug_show(D_TRACE, DEBUG_SUBSYSTEM)) {                \
00330                 typeof(rc) __rc = (rc);                                 \
00331                 LIBCFS_DEBUG_MSG_DATA_DECL(msgdata, D_TRACE, NULL);     \
00332                 libcfs_log_return(&msgdata, (long_ptr_t)__rc);          \
00333                 return __rc;                                            \
00334         }                                                               \
00335                                                                         \
00336         return (rc);                                                    \
00337 } while (0)
00338 
00339 # endif /* BITS_PER_LONG > 32 */
00340 
00341 # define ENTRY  CDEBUG(D_TRACE, "Process entered\n")
00342 # define EXIT   CDEBUG(D_TRACE, "Process leaving\n")
00343 
00344 #else /* !CDEBUG_ENTRY_EXIT || !__KERNEL__ */
00345 
00346 # define GOTO(label, rc)                                                \
00347         do {                                                            \
00348                 ((void)(rc));                                           \
00349                 goto label;                                             \
00350         } while (0)
00351 
00352 # define RETURN(rc) return (rc)
00353 # define ENTRY  do { } while (0)
00354 # define EXIT   do { } while (0)
00355 
00356 #endif /* CDEBUG_ENTRY_EXIT && __KERNEL__ */
00357 
00358 #define RETURN_EXIT                                                     \
00359 do {                                                                    \
00360         EXIT;                                                           \
00361         return;                                                         \
00362 } while (0)
